name: Books in the Bible Quiz | Bible: Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: In Esther 6 (KJV), one night when King Ahasuerus could not sleep, of whom did he read about in the book of records?
questions.explanation:
Mordecai and his heroism.

	When King Ahasuerus could not sleep, he had the book of records brought to him so he could read. When he came upon the passage that dealt with Mordecai preventing the assassination of King Ahasuerus, he called upon Haman to have Mordecai be given a royal robe, a royal crest, and a horse.

questions.text: Who asked God in Exodus 32 (KJV), to blot him out of God's book for the sins committed by the Israelites?
questions.explanation:
Moses.

	When Moses saw what Aaron and the Israelites had done with the idols he asked God to blot him out of His book for the sins committed by the Israelites. God told Moses that the only people that would be blotted out of His book were the people that committed the sin.

questions.text: Where was Jesus when he was asked to read from the book of Esaias (Isaiah) in Luke 4 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Nazareth.

	While in the synagogue Jesus read, 'The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised'. When he was finished reading, Jesus closed the book and gave it back to the teacher who gave it to Him.

questions.text: When God instructed Ezekiel to eat a scroll (book) in Ezekiel 2&3 (KJV), what did Ezekiel say the scroll (book) tasted like?
questions.explanation:
Honey.

	God instructed Ezekiel to eat the scroll in Ezekiel 2:8 and then again in Ezekiel 3:1-2. After eating the scroll, Ezekiel said God made it taste as sweet as honey. With the scroll eaten, Ezekiel went to speak to the people of Israel.

questions.text: What prophet watched everyone stand to their feet when he began reading from the book of the law in Nehemiah 8 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Ezra.

	Ezra was standing above the people behind a pulpit specifically made for him when he began reading from the book of the law. He read from the book of the law from dawn until noon.

questions.text: Where did the high priest Hilkiah find the book of the law in 2 Kings 22 (KJV)?
options: On the banks of the Red Sea
questions.explanation:
Temple.

	Hilkiah was a high priest for King Josiah. One day while he was in the temple he found the book of the law of Moses and took the book to Shaphan, the scribe.

questions.text: In 2 Kings 22 (KJV), Shaphan, the scribe, took the book of the law of Moses to what king and read it to him?
questions.explanation:
Josiah.

	Shaphan was the scribe (secretary) for King Josiah. When Hilkiah gave Shaphan the book, Shaphan immediately took the book of the law to King Josiah and read it to him.

questions.text: When the king heard the words in the book of the law of Moses in 2 Kings 22 (KJV), what action did he then take?
options: He had everyone banished from his sight
He had all the women and children in the land killed
He baptized everyone in his kingdom
questions.explanation:
He tore his clothes.

	When King Josiah heard the words that his scribe Shaphan had read to him, he tore his clothes from his body. After that, King Josiah sent five men out into the world to learn what the words in the book of the law of Moses meant. When they returned, King Josiah learned that he would die a peaceful death before he was able to see the destruction that would come to his city.

questions.text: According to Jeremiah 45 (KJV), Jeremiah dictated a book to this man.
questions.explanation:
Baruch.

	It was the fourth year of reign for King Jehoiakam when the prophet Jeremiah dictated a book to a man named Baruch. The book that Baruch wrote instructed the people that God would soon destroy everything that was built.

questions.text: After reading from the book of the law in Hebrews 9 (KJV), what did Moses sprinkle on top of the book?
questions.explanation:
Blood.

	After Moses read the rules of the book of the law to the people, he sprinkled everything in the tabernacle with blood. According to the book of the law, everything must be cleansed with the blood of God for without the blood there is no forgiveness.
